name: 討論與辯論（二）
goals: Acquire the knowledge of different debate propositions and the ability to word a debate proposition properly.
Learn about the format and structure for cross-examination debate.
Acquire the knowledge of affirmative and negative case strategies.
Acquire the skills to ask and respond to questions during cross-examination.
Apply the knowledge and skills concerning critical thinking and argumentative discourse to making and responding to arguments in English.
Learn the importance and essential skills of teamwork.
Learn about different types of formal discussion.
10.　Acquire the knowledge of dynamics of small-group discussion.
11.　Learn the skills entailed in being a good discussant.
12.　Learn the skills entailed in being a competent moderator.
13.　Acquire the ability to evaluate the discussant’s and the moderator’s performances as well as the discussion as a whole.
syllabus:
**Discussion**

**Time:** Thursday 1:20-3:10                          **Classroom:** 誠305

**Objectives**: 

Learning discussion helps students develop their reasoning and communication skills. It encourages collaborative thinking and attunes students to a multiplicity of viewpoints and perspectives. Above all, discussion can help students gain confidence in their intellectual abilities and learn how to evaluate a theory or synthesize ideas. During this course, as well as learning some **essential argumentative discourse skills**, students will learn the purpose of discussion, the roles of discussants, and the ways of planning, participating in and evaluating different types of discussion. The various reading materials are presented through a **discussion activity** **on current affairs and topics** followed by a variety of **student group workshops and discussion skill enhancement activities**. Students will be asked to make regular contributions in class and will be evaluated for their individual and teamwork performances, especially their contributions to the **two** **major task group assignments**. Finally, the shortened semester requires students to provide some **autonomous work in the form of a video**, which should be sent in at the end of the term.

2.  **Actively participate** in class discussions.
3.  You need to **submit** your **drafts _on time_** throughout the semester.
4.  **Homework** and assignments **must** **be done on time.**
5.  Smartphones, tablets, etc, must be **turned off** unless needed in class.
6.  **No eating in class**, but drinks in students own water bottles are allowed.
